Executive Summary

This Risk Management Plan (RMP) updates the City of Weslaco Water Treatment Plant from a Prevention Program 2 to a Prevention Program 3 and includes the required elements of Process Safety Management (PSM). Operations Management International, Inc. (OMI), a private contractor, operates the plant. A water treatment plant operated by a private contractor is subject to Prevention Program 3, which encompasses the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) PSM standards. The contents of this RMP and PSM document the Weslaco Water Treatment Plant¿s compliance with the Clean Air Act Section 112 (r)(7), 40 CFR 68, and 29 CFR 1910.119 for the protection of employees, the public and the environment.

This Risk Management Plan has been updated to include Process Safety Management. This involved the addition of sections on:
¿	Process Hazard Analysis 
¿	Management of Change 
¿	Pre-Startup Review
¿	Employee Participation Plans 
¿	Hot Work Permits 
¿	Contractors

The act of updating and resubmitting the RMP also involved a review or revision of the following:
¿	operating procedures
¿	training programs
¿	maintenance procedures
¿	equipment inspection
¿	Emergency Response Plan
¿	Emergency Response Training


The City of Weslaco Water Treatment Plant is located at Mile 5 West & Mile 9 North, Weslaco, Hidalgo County, Texas, at North 26.184334 Latitude and West -97.991154 Longitude. The chlorination area at the Water Treatment Plant is a loading dock that consists of a two-sided brick area that opens to the west and south and is located approximately in the middle of the facility. Six one-ton containers of chlorine are stored in the facility.  Only two of the containers are connected to the system at one time.  One is operational and the other serves as backup.  Emergency air supply and power are available.  The facility is staffed 24-hours a day and operators check the chlorination building daily. Self-Contained-Breathing-Apparatus (SCBA) are stored on-site
